title: Build Step 1 - Core Foundation for Employment Marketplace

requirements.text: Implement worker registration with essential fields: full name, mobile number, location (latitude/longitude coordinates), primary skills (multi-select from predefined list), years of experience, and wage range (minimum and maximum per day in currency units)

quotes: Worker registration with essential fields only (name, mobile, location, primary skills, experience, wage range)

acceptanceCriteria: Worker registration form captures name, mobile, location coordinates, skills, experience years, and wage range
Form validation ensures all required fields are populated before submission
Worker profile is stored in backend with unique identifier
Successfully registered workers can view their profile data

requirements.text: Implement basic job posting functionality for employers including job title, detailed description, list of required skills, offered wage per day, location coordinates, start date, end date, and number of positions available

quotes: Basic job posting (title, description, required skills, wage, location, dates)

acceptanceCriteria: Employer can create job posting with all specified fields
Job posting form validates required fields and date logic (end date after start date)
Created job postings are stored in backend with unique job ID
Employer can view their posted jobs in a list

requirements.text: Implement job browsing interface where workers can view all available job postings with filters and search capabilities, and apply to jobs that match their skills and availability
acceptanceCriteria: Workers can browse a list of all available job postings
Job listings display key information: title, required skills, wage, location, and dates
Workers can apply to jobs with a simple application action
Application is recorded in backend linking worker ID to job ID
Workers cannot apply to the same job multiple times

requirements.text: Integrate Internet Identity authentication for secure login and user identity management, ensuring each user profile is associated with their Internet Identity principal
acceptanceCriteria: Users can authenticate using Internet Identity login
Authentication state persists across browser sessions
User profiles (worker or employer) are linked to authenticated principal
Unauthenticated users are redirected to login when accessing protected routes
Logout functionality clears authentication state

requirements.text: Create a landing page with clear call-to-action for workers and employers to register or login, explaining the platform's core value proposition
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays hero section with platform description
Clear navigation paths for workers and employers to get started
Login button is prominently displayed for returning users
Landing page is the default route for unauthenticated users

requirements.text: Implement role selection flow where new users choose between 'Worker' or 'Employer' role after authentication, then are directed to the appropriate registration form
acceptanceCriteria: After first-time login, users see role selection interface
User can select either Worker or Employer role
Selected role is stored and associated with user's principal
User is redirected to role-specific registration form after selection
Role cannot be changed after initial selection without admin intervention

requirements.text: Create separate dashboard views for workers and employers: worker dashboard shows available jobs and application status; employer dashboard shows posted jobs and received applications
acceptanceCriteria: Worker dashboard displays list of available jobs matching their skills
Worker dashboard shows jobs they have applied to with status
Employer dashboard lists all jobs they have posted
Employer dashboard shows number of applications per job
Users are automatically routed to appropriate dashboard based on role

requirements.text: Apply a creative and cohesive visual design theme with a distinct style (colors, typography, layout) that reflects the employment marketplace domain. Use professional, trustworthy aesthetics suitable for connecting workers with employers. Ensure consistent styling across all pages and components.
acceptanceCriteria: Consistent color palette applied across all pages
Typography hierarchy is clear and professional
Layout patterns are cohesive throughout the application
Visual design conveys trust and professionalism appropriate for employment context

constraints: All backend logic must reside in a single Motoko actor file (backend/main.mo)
Do not modify immutable frontend paths: useInternetIdentity.ts, useInternetIdentity.tsx, useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui
Use only React, Tailwind CSS, Shadcn components, and React Query for frontend
Authentication must use Internet Identity only - no third-party auth providers
No real-time features, WebSockets, or push notifications
No GPS or geolocation APIs for automatic location detection
nonGoals: Photo and document upload functionality (deferred to Step 2)
Automated worker ID generation (deferred to Step 2)
Additional optional profile fields beyond essential fields (deferred to Step 2)
Advanced employer workflow features (deferred to Step 3)
